intro: Pseudotrophis mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao pseudotrophis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
